Key Match Events: PNG captain Assad Vala dismissed Sherfane Rutherford at the end of the 16th over, leaving West Indies five down and needing 40 from 24 balls.
Roston Chase's unbeaten 42 off 27 sealed West Indies' victory.
Roston Chase hit six and two fours off Vala in the 18th over, followed by back-to-back boundaries off Kabua Morea.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies, co-hosts of the T20 World Cup 2024, were hoping for a confident start to the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell's review of the umpire's not-out decision for Nicholas Pooran was not taken, and it would have changed the course of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: PNG opted not to review an appeal against Nicholas Pooran, which turned out to be a mistake.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell won the toss and chose to insert PNG.
